Literature.Title: A novel antifungal analog peptide derived from protaetiamycine.
Literature.Author: Lee J, Hong H, Kim JK, Hwang JS, Lee DG

Literature.Title: Design of potent 9-mer antimicrobial peptide analogs of protaetiamycine and investigation of mechanism of antimicrobial action.
Literature.Author: Shin S, Kim JK, Lee JY, Jung KW, Hwang JS, Lee J, Lee DG, Kim I, Shin SY, Kim Y

Literature.Title: Enantiomeric 9-mer Peptide Analogs of Protaetiamycine With Bacterial Cell Selectivities and Anti-Inflammatory Activities
Literature.Author: Lee E, Kim JK, Shin S, Jeong KW, Lee J, Lee DG, Hwang JS, Kim Y

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Aspergillus flavus(MIC=5µM),Candida albicans(MIC=2.5µM),Malassezia furfur(MIC=1.25µM),Trichosporon beigelii(MIC=5µM),Escherichia coli KCTC 1682(MIC=2µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa KCTC 1637(MIC=8µM),Salmonella typhimurium KCTC 1926(MIC=2µM),Bacillus subtilis KCTC 3068(MIC=2µM),Staphylococcus epidermidis KCTC 1917(MIC=1µM),Staphylococcus aureus KCTC 1621(MIC=2µM),Staphylococcus aureus CCARM 3089(MIC=4µM),Staphylococcus aureus CCARM 3114(MIC=8µM),Salmonella typhimurium CCARM 8003(MIC=4µM),Salmonella typhimurium CCARM 8007(MIC=8µM),Escherichia coli CCARM 1229(MIC=4µM)
